title.narrative: Agricultural Development: Agricultural Commodity Chain Support Project

description.narrative: The five commodity chains to be supported by PROFIL (cowpea and sesame, goats/sheep, poultry and onions) represent considerable development opportunities for the rural poor. Given a number of interesting and promising trends in terms of, inter alia, the potential for improving marketing and access to new technologies, for increasing farm gate prices as well as profit margins for rural poor actors located further downstream from production, the timeliness of support specifically to these commodity chains can be deemed highly appropriate. The domestic market is vibrant and the regional integration process is accelerating. In the context of the ECOWAP and UEMOA''s support to commodity chains, a growing number of agricultural products can now be more easily exported. Burkina Faso is particularly well placed to take advantage of this regional economic opportunity, as it borders on six neighbouring countries. The development objective of PROFIL is to reduce rural poverty by enhancing the access of the rural poor to profitable markets. Specific objectives are:to develop the links between the target groups and other commodity chain stakeholders;to strengthen the capacities of the target groups and their institutions; andto improve the access of the rural poor to productive investments and marketing services

name.narrative: Agricultural Development: Agricultural Commodity Chain Support Project

description.narrative: This point represents the centroid of the project area. For more detailed geographic information, please refer to the project page on the IFAD website.
